messages.subject: reading level and other "paths" to ignore
messages.messageBody:
<< **If we're taking a leisurely whimsical ramble through the woods and
realize
there are milestones for a "proper" walk, what would be the reason for
checking our "progress" on the milestones if our walk was suiting our
needs?** >>

Or the zoo.

People go the zoo and they pace themselves so they can see everything,
instead of deciding in advance what people want to see most, and just having
their lunch right there, in front of one of someone's favorites, and then
hotfooting it straight over to another favorite, and staying THERE long
enough to really watch.

(I know some people don't like zoos, and I didn't intend to stir that up, but
we've come to the point that we can't see the Rio Grande Zoo all in one day
anymore, and it matters to me personally now.)

Sandra
